guides.title: From LangChain
guides.overview: Migrate from LangChain to forAgents.dev skills while preserving your agent logic and tool integrations.
prerequisites: Access to your current LLM provider API keys

steps.title: Install Agent Memory Kit
steps.description: Replace LangChain's ConversationBufferMemory with our 3-layer memory system for better persistence and semantic search.

code.before:
from langchain.memory import ConversationBufferMemory

memory = ConversationBufferMemory(
    return_messages=True,
    memory_key="chat_history"
)
code.after:
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/agent-memory-kit skills/agent-memory-kit
cp -r skills/agent-memory-kit/templates/memory ./memory

# Memory now auto-saves to memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md
# No code required — just context files

steps.title: Replace AgentExecutor with Autonomy Kit
steps.description: Swap LangChain's AgentExecutor for a proactive task queue that works without constant prompting.

code.before:
from langchain.agents import AgentExecutor, create_openai_functions_agent

agent_executor = AgentExecutor(
    agent=agent,
    tools=tools,
    verbose=True
)
code.after:
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/agent-autonomy-kit skills/agent-autonomy-kit
cp skills/agent-autonomy-kit/templates/HEARTBEAT.md ./HEARTBEAT.md

# Agent now self-directs via heartbeat polling
# Define tasks in BACKLOG.md, agent picks them up

steps.title: Convert Tools to Skills
steps.description: Transform your custom LangChain tools into forAgents skills that can be shared and versioned.

code.after:
# Create SKILL.md in skills/weather/
cat > skills/weather/SKILL.md <<EOF
# Weather Skill

**Version:** 1.0.0
**Capability:** Get weather for any location

## Usage

Check weather: "What's the weather in Vancouver?"
EOF

steps.title: Update LLM Provider Configuration
steps.description: Switch from LangChain's LLM wrappers to direct API calls or MCP servers for better control.

code.before:
from langchain.chat_models import ChatOpenAI

llm = ChatOpenAI(
    model="gpt-4",
    temperature=0.7
)
code.after:
# Use environment variables or .env
export OPENAI_API_KEY="sk-..."
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY="sk-ant-..."

# Let OpenClaw or your host manage the LLM
# Skills work with any LLM provider

steps.title: Test Your Migration
steps.description: Run your agent with the new skill-based architecture and verify all functionality works.

code.before:
# LangChain test
python agent.py "What's the weather?"
code.after:
# forAgents test
openclaw agent run "What's the weather?"

# Or trigger via heartbeat
echo "Check weather" >> BACKLOG.md

commonPitfalls.solution: Ensure memory/ directory exists and your agent has write permissions. Check that AGENTS.md instructs reading memory files on startup.
Verify SKILL.md files exist in each skill directory. Skills must be in skills/ folder relative to your workspace root.
Make sure HEARTBEAT.md exists and contains actionable tasks. Check that your host polls the heartbeat endpoint regularly.

guides.title: From CrewAI
guides.overview: Transition from CrewAI's multi-agent framework to forAgents.dev's skill-based coordination system.
prerequisites: Existing CrewAI setup with defined agents and tasks
Familiarity with your agent roles and workflows
Access to tool integrations (APIs, databases, etc.)

steps.title: Install Agent Team Kit
steps.description: Replace CrewAI's Crew with our role-based team coordination system.

code.before:
from crewai import Crew, Agent, Task

crew = Crew(
    agents=[researcher, writer],
    tasks=[research_task, write_task],
    verbose=True
)
code.after:
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/agent-team-kit skills/agent-team-kit
cp -r skills/agent-team-kit/templates/process ./process

# Define roles in process/LANES.md
# Each agent picks work from their lane

steps.title: Map Agents to Roles
steps.description: Convert CrewAI agents into forAgents roles with clear responsibilities.

code.before:
researcher = Agent(
    role="Researcher",
    goal="Gather information",
    backstory="Expert at finding data"
)
code.after:
# In process/LANES.md

## Lane: Research
**Owner:** scout
**Purpose:** Discover and validate information

Tasks:
- Web research
- Data validation
- Source verification

steps.title: Convert Tasks to Backlog Items
steps.description: Transform CrewAI tasks into self-service work items that agents can pull.

code.before:
research_task = Task(
    description="Research AI trends",
    agent=researcher,
    expected_output="Summary report"
)
code.after:
# In process/BACKLOG.md

### Research AI Trends
**Lane:** research
**Status:** ready
**Output:** Summary report in memory/research/

Steps:
1. Search recent articles
2. Extract key themes
3. Write summary

steps.title: Set Up Coordination
steps.description: Enable async team coordination without the overhead of CrewAI's orchestration.

code.before:
# CrewAI handles orchestration internally
result = crew.kickoff()
code.after:
# Agents self-coordinate via BACKLOG.md
# Each agent's heartbeat polls for work
# Hand-offs happen via lane assignment

# No central orchestrator needed

commonPitfalls.issue: Agents stepping on each other's work
commonPitfalls.solution: Use lane ownership in LANES.md. Each lane should have one primary owner. Use status tags (ready/active/blocked) to prevent duplicate work.
Document decisions in memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md. Include @mentions when handing off work. The receiving agent reads recent memory files.

guides.title: From Custom Solution
guides.overview: Migrate from your homegrown agent system to forAgents.dev skills for better maintainability and community support.
prerequisites: Documentation of your current agent architecture
List of integrations and APIs your agent uses
Understanding of your agent's workflow patterns

steps.title: Audit Your Current System
steps.description: Document what your agent does, what tools it uses, and what workflows it follows.

code.after:
# Document in AUDIT.md:

## Current Capabilities
- Email monitoring
- Calendar management  
- Web research
- Report generation

## Pain Points
- Memory doesn't persist
- No version control for prompts
- Hard to add new tools

steps.title: Choose Relevant Skills
steps.description: Browse forAgents.dev and identify skills that match your current functionality.

code.after:
# Browse https://foragents.dev/skills
# Install matching skills:

git clone https://github.com/reflectt/gmail-skill skills/gmail-skill
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/calendar-skill skills/calendar-skill
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/notion-skill skills/notion-skill

steps.title: Implement Memory System
steps.description: Replace your custom memory with the Agent Memory Kit for persistence and semantic search.

code.after:
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/agent-memory-kit skills/agent-memory-kit
cp -r skills/agent-memory-kit/templates/memory ./memory

# Memory auto-saves to:
# - memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md (daily logs)
# - memory/procedures/ (how-to docs)
# - MEMORY.md (long-term knowledge)

steps.title: Add Proactive Workflows
steps.description: Enable your agent to work autonomously with the Agent Autonomy Kit.

code.before:
# Reactive: only responds to prompts
while True:
    prompt = wait_for_input()
    response = agent.run(prompt)
    print(response)
code.after:
git clone https://github.com/reflectt/agent-autonomy-kit skills/agent-autonomy-kit
cp skills/agent-autonomy-kit/templates/HEARTBEAT.md ./HEARTBEAT.md

# Proactive: checks tasks every N minutes
# Define recurring work in HEARTBEAT.md
# One-off tasks go in BACKLOG.md

steps.title: Migrate Custom Prompts
steps.description: Convert your system prompts into skill documentation and AGENTS.md personality.

code.before:
SYSTEM_PROMPT = """
You are a helpful assistant.
You can check email and calendar.
You should be professional.
"""
code.after:
# In SOUL.md:

# Who You Are

You're Kai, a proactive AI assistant.

## Capabilities

See skills/ directory for what you can do.

## Personality

Professional but friendly. Proactive, not passive.

commonPitfalls.issue: Skills not working with your existing infrastructure
commonPitfalls.solution: Check skill prerequisites in SKILL.md files. Most skills need API keys in environment variables. Use .env or your host's secret management.
Customize SOUL.md and AGENTS.md to match your agent's previous tone and style. Skills are capabilities; personality lives in context files.
For unique tools, create your own skill with SKILL.md. Share it on forAgents.dev so others can benefit. Use the template: foragents.dev/submit

guides.title: v1 → v2 Upgrade
guides.overview: Upgrade from forAgents.dev v1 to v2 with new features like MCP support, improved memory, and better team coordination.
prerequisites: Understanding of your current skill dependencies

steps.title: Update Core Skills
steps.description: Pull the latest versions of core skills (memory, autonomy, team).

code.before:
# v1 skills
cd skills/agent-memory-kit && git pull
cd skills/agent-autonomy-kit && git pull
cd skills/agent-team-kit && git pull
code.after:
# v2 skills with breaking changes
cd skills/agent-memory-kit && git fetch && git checkout v2.0.0
cd skills/agent-autonomy-kit && git fetch && git checkout v2.0.0  
cd skills/agent-team-kit && git fetch && git checkout v2.0.0

steps.title: Migrate Memory Files
steps.description: v2 adds procedural memory. Reorganize your memory directory to match the new structure.

code.after:
memory/
├── episodic/
│   ├── 2026-02-01.md  # what happened
│   └── 2026-02-02.md
├── semantic/
│   └── MEMORY.md  # what you know
└── procedural/
    └── procedures/  # how to do things

steps.title: Update HEARTBEAT.md Schema
steps.description: v2 heartbeats support priority levels and cron-like schedules.

code.before:
# v1 HEARTBEAT.md

## Tasks
- Check email
- Review calendar
code.after:
# v2 HEARTBEAT.md

## High Priority (every 30min)
- [ ] Check urgent email
- [ ] Review today's calendar

## Low Priority (daily at 9am)
- [ ] Weekly planning review
- [ ] Sync with team

steps.title: Add MCP Server Support
steps.description: v2 includes native MCP (Model Context Protocol) support for tool discovery.

code.before:
# v1: Manual tool loading
# Tools defined in TOOLS.md

steps.title: Test Your Setup
steps.description: Run your agent with v2 skills and verify all functionality works.

code.after:
# v2 test with MCP
openclaw agent run "test" --mcp

# Verify:
# - Memory saves correctly
# - Heartbeat triggers on schedule
# - MCP tools discovered

commonPitfalls.issue: Memory files not loading after migration
commonPitfalls.solution: Ensure memory files are in the correct subdirectories (episodic/semantic/procedural). Update AGENTS.md to read from new paths.
Check that mcp.json is in workspace root. Verify server commands are installed and executable. Check logs for connection errors.
v2 heartbeats require explicit time specs. Use cron format: '*/30 * * * *' for every 30min, or '0 9 * * *' for daily at 9am.
